description.raw:
The debian build system supports `dh_missing` commands inside `rules` files to list the missing files from packages.

To automatically enable it for all builds I did not find a different way that force the standards behaviour in `debian/compat` to level 12 \(only present in bionic and above\) that use the list missing files by default. This way we don't need to modify all the `-release`repos.

The parsing code makes the build to be marked as unstable but still uploads the packages.

‌

Tested here:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-rendering2-debbuilder&build=13)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/13/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/13)

After fixing the missing files:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-rendering2-debbuilder&build=14)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/14/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/14/))

To automatically enable it for all builds I did not find a different way that force the standards behaviour in debian/compat to level 12 (only present in bionic and above) that use the list missing files by default. This way we don't need to modify all the -releaserepos.

The parsing code makes the build to be marked as unstable but still uploads the packages.

‌

Tested here:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/13/

After fixing the missing files:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-rendering2-debbuilder/14/)

title.raw: Mark deb builder runs as unstable if some files are not being packaged
